text: This is exactly how I see it, he handles better than most in bad situations (non emergency ones anyway) and struggles with everyday life.

name: overmedicated
text: Older seasons are more worthy. Chubbied.

name: catachresis
text: A comment left by catachresis was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by straw, taiiga, ishuta, mikeronomicon, Thorfinn, SchnappM, GeyserShitdick, kylemcjuicy, mortshire, jollysaintpete, NDCaesar, Sweetlips, nipsy43, sncether)

name: ckiahtipes
text: A comment left by ckiahtipes was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by featurelessvoid, lazarusloafer, Archon_Divinus, SotiCoto)

name: philosophe
text: "Compliment Sandwich"

name: overmedicated
text: Family Guy?

name: overmedicated
text: Jesus. They're here.

name: achilleselbow
text: As much as Family Guy may not be hipster-elitist, I think hating on it may be even less so now that South Park has done it. Just because frat guys enjoy mindlessly repeating Stewie's 'evil' lines does not make the rest of the show bad. You give me another show that's clever enough to make reference to The Picture of Dorian Gray in a one-off joke and I'll give you a chubby.

name: tekende
text: I don't remember the Dorian Grey joke. What was it?

name: clintisiceman
text:
I'm having trouble with the exact context, but one of the female characters asks a general question about the quality of her appearance, and Stewie responds with something like "let me put it this way. Somewhere in an attic there is a painting of you getting prettier."

I probably fucked it up, but I'm pretty sure that's what he was referring to. But then again, this is 3 months later and you probably do not care anymore.

name: tekende
text:
Yeah, that's it. I actually saw that episode a couple weeks after I posted that comment. I was all like "oh yeah, that's it, man, that's subtler than I expected."

Thanks though!

name: alejandroadam
text: A comment left by alejandroadam was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by ted0phile, daidai, mikeronomicon, DougTheHead, nipsy43)

name: alejandroadam
text: A comment left by alejandroadam was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by missbee, ishuta, mikeronomicon, Thorfinn, EM2, FirePowa8, morypcaina, DougTheHead, Cracklewater, Sloppy_Henry, Jesus, foetus_punch)

name: ishuta
text: A comment left by ishuta was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by Thorfinn, _cheesekayke, Darthemed)

name: foetus_punch
text: Hey alejandroadam? Shut the fuck up. The Fall are quite a good band, you are being needlessly hostile, and although I don't agree with catachresis I agree with his right to a fucking opinion.

name: alejandroadam
text:
I didn't say there were bad, just not well know. you should read what I wrote before you attack me for writing something I didn't

this back and forth your commenting on is a year old, back when assetbar came out, and no one posted much, I was just tired of hearing catachresis state is hatered of every comic in a row of 6 or 8. it got old. I knee-jerked. but thanks for attacking me.

name: foetus_punch
text:
Okay then, I interpreted what you said...weirdly. And it was totally lame that I didn't look at the dates on these things. That's okay. I can totally admit that . But beyond that, I stand by what you said. To be perfectly honest, I feel that maybe people should be a little bit more critical of this comic. We know it is great, you can stop posting that, but maybe if someone finds some little detail or something that bothers them, they can mention it. At least that is...interestin'.

Anyway, I am shitty and lame for carrying this on, and if you stop talking you WILL be the bigger man.

name: woodenteeth
text: but what if I keep talking?

name: cpnglxynchos
text: i'll lame you for fun.

name: cpnglxynchos
text: and then others will lame me, out of spite.

name: foetus_punch
text: Oh, nay, sir.

name: woodenteeth
text: I have used up my fun-lame allotment. I [i]was[/] going to do something nice. You don't UNDERSTAND Assetbar!

name: woodenteeth
text: ohhhh fuck you bbcode.

name: taiiga
text: i will, sir, i will.

name: nighttoad
text: even though you will probably never see my reply, i want you to know that i got your reference. you are not alone in being a fan of the fall, but you may be alone in disliking "wings."

name: morypcaina
text:
It's better than Ludd Gang. *shrug*
But maybe I just like it because, being an American, I feel like I can better connect to MES somewhat, with that US Civil War reference.

name: howl
text: OMG YOUR AVATARICON

name: agika
text: Poor Roast Beef.  No one else's talking, and I'm willing to bet that Lyle has fallen asleep also.

name: chaesar
text: I bet Beef spends about all of his free time reminescing on his childhood, which is unfortunate due to Circumstances.

name: senseihollywood
text: I somehow feel glad for Beef that he doesn't know such things as queefs are real and among us...ah, innocence...

name: cheeks_jd
text: A comment left by cheeks_jd was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by ButterMoths, eatmorekix, crawfomp, sonicbiology)

name: ovenface
text: at least two people seem to think you are wrong, that queefs are awesome and a turn on.

name: straw
text: Not so much that, but it's just a process.  It's a sign things are being Done Right and with good honesty.

name: foetus_punch
text: It is nice when a girl says "That is gross later", making you feel vindicated.

name: cpnglxynchos
text:
but it's hilarious when you both laugh about it when you hear one for the first time.

(yes, this happened to me.)

name: undyingsong
text: I have yet to have this happen to me, so I still do not really believe that they exist.

name: morganization
text: lyle always speaks the truth that everyone thinks but is afraid to say

name: epicurus
text: I think the reason Beef is acting different than normal is the darkness and isolation playing with his personality a bit. He is more comfortable here than normal.

name: mxh
text: I wouldn't rule out cocaine though. I don't know if he would just spontaneously bring the matter up like that.

name: achewoodno1fan
text: yo catach i dont think you really know roast beef. he's opening up because theyre in a dark room with nobody to see him

name: tetrisattack
text: Lyrics to a 2 Live Crew song are the first results on Google for "Yall Suck Dick"

name: foetus_punch
text: Why were you looking up Yall Suck Dick on Google?

name: cpnglxynchos
text: WHY FIND OUT?

name: foetus_punch
text: Makes me want to type through a napkin.

name: tttt
text:
alt. text adds a 'the' and makes it so much funnier for some reason. It's the little things.

and I don't know why such a bizarre reference was made but "Wings" is a great Fall song

name: slalvation
text: It was because that dude wanted to say that he liked that band.

name: fineoakstructure
text: yes beef i agree i spent some time grappling with the unbridled sexual nature of 2 live crew also.  not so much the concepts but the open nature in a public forum it was philosophical

name: leahpidoptera
text:
Beef seems so in his element here.

All he's missing is a yellow pillow and some cigars.

name: dasilodavi
text: Something about a dark, cramped, possibly sweat-smelling box that brings out the philanthropist in Roast Beef.

name: fvvs
text: Sorry, I did not mean to lame that. Bad cursor aim at 5 in the morning is responsible.

name: blackash
text: A comment left by blackash was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by FVVS, aliiis, Thorfinn, EM2, capslock_annliv, catgrl131, idsyen, peppill, theplaidknight, Wulvaine, sncether, AmonRunsAmok, stormagnet)

name: rowboat
text: Everyone seems perfectly in character to me, if not slightly altered by the situation (you sayin' you never break character? Not even in the dark?). But at the same time, Lyle says all that needs to be said about this arc. Though I am totally with Beef on the effects of 2 Live Crew on relatively virgin ears. For me, it ushered in a turning point. The cut I'll always remember best is "Welcome To The Fuckshop." (GONG)

name: j03y
text: he doesnt believe in queefs?

name: tinhand
text:
In the words of South Parks Mr Mackey:
"A queef is a vaginal expulsion of gas, m'kay."
I imagine that the others know this (Lyle at least), but are too pissed off and tired to care and wish that Beef would stop carrying on such as a fool does.

name: mattylite
text:
Achewood ontology: Trouble is a fake idea. Queefs are a fake concept.
(I am sorry for using the word ontology I don't mean to be high faluting)

name: echidnaboy
text: Falute away, friend. Falute as high as you damn well please.

name: shirt145
text: Oh craps I totally meant to chubby you!  I dig reanalysis and backformation.

name: tekende
text: And a Mexican George Clooney is a neat concept.

name: snowman
text: POSIT

name: aliiis
text:
In the first panel I thought Lyle was gearing up for a bird-flip, like that was his middle finger half folded down. Like he was just getting ready to flip off all the inhabitants of the dumbwaiter, or the dumbwaiter itself, or the world at large for being boring.
Now I think it is the top of a bottle of bourbon. I don't know whether to be disappointed or think it is awesome that he has brought a bottle with him at all times.

name: ham_shoes
text: I can identify with Beef's wanting to resolve these unanswered questions.  The idea of a queef, and the books of T. Pynchon, are things I just can't find anybody to discuss with.  I did get lucky though on the 2 Live Crew discussion regarding the song where they say "Heeyyyyy we want some Pus-Say!"  My friend told me, "they're just saying what they want".  And that made me feel like it wasn't so crass.

name: ham_shoes
text: Or was it Luke Skyywalker

name: tekende
text:
No, Luke Skywalker said "Heeyyyyy I'm a pus-say! I was gonna go down to Toshi station and pick up some power converters and see if they had the lastest Morrissey record waahh WAAH WAHHHH"

Okay, that kind of got away from me there.

name: dtuba
text: No, no. That was good.

name: puguglypress
text: My gf queefed once in high school, I didn't know what a queef was so I started making fun of her for farting. Then she told me what it actually was, and then suddenly I REALLY smelled it. Oh god, it lingers to this day
